meanings.definition: An alcoholic drink made from the fermented juice of apples.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a glass of cider at the party.
meanings.sent2: She bought a bottle of cider for the barbecue.
meanings.sent3: The cider was so strong it made me dance like a silly goose.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of cider filled the room, warming our spirits.
meanings.sent5: The cider sparkled in the sunlight, tempting everyone to take a sip.

meanings.definition: A non-alcoholic drink made from the juice of apples.
meanings.sent1: My grandma always serves cider during family gatherings.
meanings.sent2: The kids love to drink cider with their snacks.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled cider on my shirt, making it smell fruity.
meanings.sent4: The sweet taste of cider reminded me of childhood picnics.
meanings.sent5: The refreshing cider quenched my thirst on a hot summer day.

meanings.definition: A drink made from the juice of apples, typically served hot and spiced.
meanings.sent1: During winter, I like to sip on warm cider by the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: The cafe down the street serves the best spiced cider.
meanings.sent3: The spicy cider made my nose tingle with delight.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of spiced cider filled the kitchen, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The hot cider warmed me up from the inside out on a chilly evening.
